main event: Two bright white objects, the size of a nickel, were observed moving in the sky over Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania on November 15, 1956.
interesting points: The objects appeared at the horizon, then moved down and disappeared instantaneously, as if a light had been switched off.
One object was slightly below and smaller than the other.
The objects were observed for about 60 minutes.
The observer, a housewife, described the objects as emitting the most intense white light she had ever seen.
No possible cause for the sighting could be determined by the investigating intelligence officer.
sighted object: two bright white objects, the size of a nickel
